website_summaries.verdict: A quality wall-mounted bar that offers different grip positions.
pros: A solidly constructed bar that is easy to install
cons: Bolts are of low quality, so you may want to provide your own

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it gave out on me in the middle of the workout! Is there a warranty!?
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and sturdy however the design limits some exercises.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and very sturdy when properly mounted. I used the included template to mount it into the header and studs above my door. I can jump up, grab the bar and work out without fear of it ripping out of the wall. My only gripe are the two hand grips that stick straight out from the wall. When I do a chin up (with my palms facing me) my shoulders hit these bars limiting how high I can go. A bit annoying. Otherwise it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: BlueTeej

customer_reviews.title: cross bar placement
customer_reviews.text: It seems odd that the instructions tell you to mount the cross bar below the two arms that attach to the wall however the same instructions show the cross bar above the two arms. It seems like it would be that much sturdier if you attach the cross bar above the two arms. Also, the instructions tell you to use a 5/16" drill bit however if you do the lag bolts have next to nothing to grab into considering the lag bolts are not much more than 5/16" diameter. I would say it seems pretty sturdy and I'm tempted to attach the cross bar above the arms
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Burlington

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging and quality control
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this bar. However, both items I received (the original and a replacement) had scrapes on the front of the plates that go against the wall. I believe this was caused by a lack of packing material between the bar ends and the plates, as they are in direct contact in the box. I also found that the plates were bowed up as much as 1/8" at the ends when I placed them on a flat surface. The manufacturer needs to implement better quality control and improvements on the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.  I started out using this thing at 260lbs
customer_reviews.text: Now, I'm at 235lbs thanks for this and ew exercise equipment and a keto diet. I love that this thing has 3 different hand configurations, so I can switch between different types of pull ups. After my first worked it with this thing, my biceps were shredded in a way I haven't felt for a while. And I've been going bicep curls with dumbbells for a while. This thing is 100x easier and safer than a doorway-mounted pull up bar. It feels very solid, as long as you get the bolts into your studs, which this bar is designed to do if you have standard 18" spaced studs.
customer_reviews.author: Darnell Arford

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, high quality, long lasting!
customer_reviews.text: I securely mounted this product on my garage wall, and it is not going anywhere. It is super sturdy and has lasted 8 years and counting. This bar sports multiple grips and grip angles. You need to make sure that your mounting spot is well thought through; namely, making sure that it is high enough so that your feet do not touch the floor, and yet not too high where your head does not clear the ceiling. This may sound silly but trust me! You may need to use gloves when you actually use the bar, I do. This is a quality, long lasting product that will serve you well.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Mangone

customer_reviews.title: Solid and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: It’s super solid. The install also is very easy with the template. However, I used a quarter inch strawberry bit and not the 5/16 recommended. Another factor is that the wall plates might not be super straight but once you tighten to the studs it doesn’t matter. The only thing I’m not totally sure about is the fact that when I do chin ups and pull-ups I sometimes hit the parallel bars that protrude. So that limits a bit how far up you can go. But it also gives you more hand positions. Overall, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Garbage- don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Glad I measured myself instead of using the sheet they provide for their own product. Where the bolt goes into the bar its square cut not circle so it won’t go in flush had to switch the bar to the top of the brace to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Cody edwards

customer_reviews.title: Verify grip width prior to purchase
customer_reviews.text: The unit is solid and easy to assemble/install. I am of generally average size for a male (5-10 -- 150) and have found that the portion of the assembly that anchors to the wall and supports the bar is exactly where I would want to place my hands so I have to either shift to one side or use a wider grip than desired. Not a deal breaker but something to keep in mind if you want to choose a comfortable width. Units that have wider attachment points likely do not cause the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: John Cranfill

customer_reviews.title: Well built and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to have to move stuff around, make adjustments every time I wanted to exercise. The pull up bar is well built, very sturdy, and has 4 positions that give you numerous exercise options. It was perfect for me...
customer_reviews.author: bigal

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This took me about 5 minutes to install. It is slim and works great in my small workout room. I am 170lbs and it hold up perfectly. Absolutely no complaints and would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: charli

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Got this a while back for my husbands birthday and he absolutely loves it! Very sturdy and easy to install. He's 220+ lbs and it's gotten a lot of use and it was still secure on the wall. He loves having it at home as he can knock out some pull ups anytime he walks by it. My 2 year old also loves when daddy helps him do some :)
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S

customer_reviews.title: Bent with minimal use
customer_reviews.text: Pull up bar bent with only a few weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: Gina T

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces. Bass customer service
customer_reviews.text: This came missing one of the arms. I called the manufacturer and the assured me they would send a new one but it did not arrive. I called again and was assured i would be emailed a tracking number. I did not get it. I am going to have to return the 2 pieces i DID get. So sad.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Giancarlo

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t flex under weight, comes with a guide to help drill holes, good size, good value
customer_reviews.author: erganimal

customer_reviews.title: Strong pull-up bar
customer_reviews.text: This pull-up bar has been great. The installation was straight-forward (esp. w/help from videos online).I had some concern that it might pull away from the wall (even though it's in studs) and it has been nothing but rock-solid. After 3-4 months, the padded grips are still in great shape. I like having the wide grip and the perpendicular handles as it allows for more exercises. Our two kids were excited about getting it and we've all been using it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: B. Marsales

customer_reviews.title: Great Wall-mounted Pull-up bar
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pull-up bar because I wanted something more permanent and rigidly mounted than the over the door models that are available. Although billed to be non-marking and non-destructive, I've seen those bars do plenty of both. I installed this over a door opening in a utility room with exposed studs - I attached a 2x10 with lag bolts into the studs then mounted the pull-up bar to the 2x10 with nuts/bolts/washers. Pros: 1) Very strong and well constructed. The bar does not creak even during kipping pullups 2) Numerous hand positions Cons: 1) After a year of use (3-4 times/week), the rubber grips are starting the wear 2) Read the other reviews on installation directions and required revisions
customer_reviews.author: Sinclair A.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Great bar. I'm 6'2" almost 200 lbs and it works just fine. P90X is a regular in my household so it gets used for pull-ups, a lot. Used it to replace a chin up tower which was equally great. I wanted to clear more floor space and have something to anchor tethers to for suspension training. The chin tower was threatening to fall over from suspension training. I was going to get longer lag screws and mount it through a piece of pressure treated lumber. I should have done that. The creaking of the drywall can be very unnerving.
customer_reviews.author: AJS0121

customer_reviews.title: Decent Pull Up Bar
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for my P90X style workouts, unfortunately the bar is about 6 inches to close to the wall making some of the less traditional moves difficult to perform without banging your head. I can't really blame the manufacturer as I should have looked more closely at the dimensions, although I don't recall if that particular measurement was indicated in the specs. Overall, the construction is solid, easy to install, and works as advertised. I'm about 5' 11" with average to slightly longer arms and feel the "spread" of the bar could be a little wider allowing for a "very wide grip" option.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: First bar came damaged
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get my bar but the package came in terrible condition and had obviously been re -staples closed. I wasn’t too worried but when I opened it the bar had been damaged on both sides, one plastic cap completely busted in. I’m not happy. Update: My replacement bar arrived and seems to be in good condition. I’ll have to modify some things before I can thoroughly test and rate the product. + 2 stars
customer_reviews.author: Chase Haggerton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Tried a few things on my own since gym closed but hung this up easy and it’s sturdy. Have a level 5/16 drill bit and size 17 socket also need a 1/2 socket. Make sure you have a sturdy wall. I had to do some some reinforcing in my garage but has nothing To do with the product. Put it up and together in 10-15 minutes tops.
customer_reviews.author: MG7

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Just as expected. We installed this in the garage aka "home gym". Directions were very straight forward. Extremely sturdy and came with everything needed to install. Start to finish about a 30 minute install. Recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my son for Christmas and it is PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: My 13 year old son wanted a pull up bar for Christmas and the doorway type do not work in our house and even if they did we'd still have purchased this one. My husband put it on my son's bedroom wall and he has been using it since Christmas and LOVES it. He keeps getting stronger and stronger, his muscles are getting bigger and bigger and he can do more and more reps each week. It not only works his arms and shoulder but also his abs. He holds himself up and pulls his knees to his chest. This pull up bar is made VERY WELL and we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Dreamwatcher

customer_reviews.title: This bar is very well made and comfrotbale to use. 1k pullups and it feels brand new
customer_reviews.text: Extremely sturdy pullup bar. The setup is good. Wish the normal grip was easier but the inside of the hands contact the edge of the support bars. I have done over 1000 pullups on this bar and the foam is still holding up. The one bad thing is my foam on the middle part rolls which is why I deducted a star. Other than that you can really trust and rely on this sturdy bar. The newer updates they made to the design are great.
customer_reviews.author: fillycheese

customer_reviews.title: Have had it for 5 years now and still good as new
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 5 years ago and have been using for the past 5 years. Have had no issues. I estimate I've done about 100 pull ups/week over that time so maybe 25,000 in total. I'm about 170 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: KidHorn

customer_reviews.title: everything I hoped it would be
customer_reviews.text: I looked at several different chin up bar options available on amazon. I read many of the customer reviews. This product was acceptably priced and had enough good reviews to make it worth giving a try. It arrived promptly, well packed. Assembled easily, with not production flaws. The carton clearly states made in China. Previous experience with Chinese hardware, along with some customer reviews prompted me to drive up to Lowes and purchase a couple dollars worth of replacement fasteners. So I didn't have any problems hanging this unit on my porch (wood beam).
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy unit
customer_reviews.text: This bar is well worth it's price. I had no problem installing it other than the fact that the cheap wrench they included didn't fit anything. I'm not saying it was a little loose, I mean it was at least 2-3 sizes bigger than the bolts. It really didn't matter though, because the bolts are 3-1/2" long, and it would have taken a bear to put those in with that wrench anyway. After predrilling the holes, I used a 1/2" drive ratchet and they went right in with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoFXusa

customer_reviews.title: Great bar
customer_reviews.text: ...and it has been kicking my butt. Have it mounted outside for now. Do as many various pull-ups as I can and then split wood to finish off my workout. Total upper-body workout.
customer_reviews.author: Samurai Young

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated that packaging doesn't match, the pictures
customer_reviews.text: Was super excited to start crushing pull-ups, only to have my spirits dampened when I opened it and the packaging lacked the required screws to put it on the wall. Also didn't receive the Ultimate Body Press Wall Mounted Pull Up Bar, we got the Big Mike's Fitness Pull up bar. Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.author: N. Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Works well !!
customer_reviews.text: Took less than 30 mins to install. My basement is not finished. It just installed on 2X4. Comes with all the hardware needed.
customer_reviews.author: Event Horizon

customer_reviews.title: ... concrete wall - this was indeed impressive - incredibly sturdy..
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pull up bar that could be mounted onto a concrete wall - this was indeed impressive - incredibly sturdy...foam padding on the arms and length of it. It's mounted about 7inches away from the wall making it a somewhat tight fit...but nothing that limits you in my opinion...arrived in record time, perfectly packaged - came missing 1 washer, but that doesnt deserve the loss of a star. I do not regret this purchase or dealing with this supplier... and would say its a staple to any home gym!
customer_reviews.author: SeaDips

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Where Do I start, installed onto the wall in my Garage with ease. Can hold every bit of a bigger guy’s weight. I went from no pull-ups, unassisted- to be able to do 5 in about 6 weeks or less. Great quality and design. Would recommend to anyone looking
customer_reviews.author: OFFENHAEUSER GARRY

customer_reviews.title: Solid product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Solid construction. Foam grips are a bit soft. I'm 5'11, weigh 190 and can do 22 smooth but rapid pull ups and it works fine. 2x4 studs in wall. Can't attest to how it would hold up to herky jerky "kipping", kicking and such. Use careful centering and proper pre-drilling and you'll be fine. I bolted it up with socket wrench and it took very little time. Electric torque drill/driver totally unnecessary for screwing lag bolts in.
customer_reviews.author: K. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Padded pull up bar
customer_reviews.text: Really like the sturdiness. Wish there were beveled handles as well as padded for options because the padding fatigues my grip quickly. It’s held up outdoors without rusting and holds my husband at 250lb no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Washington

customer_reviews.title: Good price, great item!
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good solid bar for a good price. Not sure why all the confusion. Instructions seem straightforward and simple. It does say 7/16" pilot when it should say 7/32" pilot. Otherwise very simple (2 bolts to put it together) and solid. I mounted it over a double-wide closet with bifold doors, so when I open the doors there are no issues w/my knees hitting the wall. It's still fine w/the doors closed or with a wall there. I like this over the door-jamb versions because I can hand full extended on this and stretch my back (i'm 5'10")
customer_reviews.author: David Houggy Jr

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We set up this bar without much problem, and ten months later it is working as fine as ever. Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far, this product is excellent. I weigh 180 lbs and was able to do pull ups with 40 extra pounds without any issues. Just make sure you secure it properly.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Great choice. Good price
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to assemble and install. Have done thousands of pull-ups on it and still like a rock. If you have trouble installing it it is NOT the fault of the product. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: SaraC

customer_reviews.title: Good bar, instructions fixed
customer_reviews.text: This bar does a very good job. It's a pullup bar, what is there really to say about it? It fixes to the wall firmly and does not seem at risk of breaking or coming un-attached. The directions were easy to follow (the video review was even easier). The apparent error in the directions on size of drill bit has been fixed. The only reason this doesn't get 5 stars is because the grips are less than awesome. They will sometimes rotate and they are kind of abrasive. That being said your hand should not slip off of them, so ultimately they do their job.
customer_reviews.author: N. G.

customer_reviews.title: Get buff
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. You'll want to mount directly to the studs, not into drywall.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Item received as well!
customer_reviews.text: Did not receive the pull up bar. Received the Dip bar instead.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Williams

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy design and made of very high quality metal
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy design and made of very high quality metal. I could tell as soon as I took this product out of the box that I made a good purchase and would be using this product for years to come. The bars are very thick sized and the padding was very comfortable and felt like it was put on very well. This also comes with 4 anchor bolts so you just need to find a sturdy wall, drill some holes and attach the 3 pieces together. The total set up time was roughly 20 minutes for me and 1 other person, very easy assembly indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lombardo

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Installed following instructions (and referenced those in comments) - One screw would not thread so I went to home depot and got another one. So far holding up great for pull ups - with or without pull up assist bands. Weight ~#200 and feel sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: DraftingDigital

customer_reviews.title: Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: And that was only one support bracket. Maybe you could do pull ups with one support bracket and a bar but I am not that adventurous. A bit embarrassing that the extra support bracket wasn't packed, but oh well. For what it's worth, it felt sturdy pulling two-thirds of the product out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: well built and I like that I can do a pull up with various ...
customer_reviews.text: I researched this product and others before settling on this brand. I installed a base platform to the studs in the wall first so the stress was more distributed and then installed this product. It is solid, well built and I like that I can do a pull up with various hand positions.
customer_reviews.author: Texan

customer_reviews.title: Questionable durability, poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Installed directly into garage studs. One lag screw has started to rip out - emailed and called customer support for help or a longer screw. No response. Screw is currently half inch pulled out of wall.
customer_reviews.author: William A Witte

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Not cheap I weigh 195 lbs and it works perfect I got it for my daughter and to my amuse i can use it when ever i like very good and well built product.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth lynch

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty. i replaced the lag bolts with new ...
customer_reviews.text: heavy duty. i replaced the lag bolts with new ones from lowes based on the reviews of others and had no problems. i weigh 190 lbs and mounted the bar directly through drywall into two studs with no backing board. no movement whatsoever. its a little close to the wall but this is not an issue for me. if you are looking to do xfit kip up style pull ups then you should get a ceiling mount bar.
customer_reviews.author: hd

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but 16" spacing (for mounting to studs) seems to be sub-optimal
customer_reviews.text: High quality product but the 16" on center mounts / posts seem like they are right where I want to put my hands when I do chin-ups. That's my only complaint. Comes with substantial mounting hardware so it feels rock solid when mounted to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fix-it / Engineer

customer_reviews.title: solid pull up bar but sometimes it feels too close to the wall
customer_reviews.text: After using the pullup bar for about 2 weeks I have come to the conclusion that it is too close to the wall. It would be perfect if it would extend out a few more inches. I may consider mounting a 2x6 to the wall and then mounting the pull up bar to that. I find that either my feet or my back are always touching the wall, that being said...it feels safe and works well enough for my home gym (which is why I give it 4/5 stars).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: solid
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and great price point. Quality mounting hardware too.
customer_reviews.author: A Scheifele

customer_reviews.title: Came and works as expected. The only thing I'd ...
customer_reviews.text: Came and works as expected. The only thing I'd subtract 1/2 a star for is that one of the bars had slight rust around the edge and one of the caps were dislodged. Couldn't get it back in.
customer_reviews.author: Night

customer_reviews.title: Solid system!
customer_reviews.text: Installation went good but would have liked to have a height recommendation for where to place holes so the bar would be at 85 inches from floor. The unit itself is solid once installed and also anchors a band system. I suspect it is sturdy enough for a TRX type suspension system also.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: seems like it will work out fine
customer_reviews.text: The bar was easy to install after watching a youtube video. The screws creak and strain when I put my weight on it so I do so gingerly. I'm 150 pounds and feel if I'm not careful, it will pull out of the wall. It seems sturdy otherwise. With a strained muscle in my shoulder, all I've been able to do so far is hang, but I notice it gets easier each time.
customer_reviews.author: a customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bar - easy to use and easy to install (watch out for the one error in the instructions!)
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this. Be sure to read the review on here that has a video in it and note the warning about the size of the drill bit needed to make the pilot holes in your wall studs - the instructions that came with the bar at my time of purchase STILL had not been updated or corrected. Aside from that error on the instructions the installation was fairly simple and can be done by one person.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Blitz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. I coudn't be happier.
customer_reviews.text: I originally had one of the doorway pull up bars, but where I had to place it was inconvenient for my workout routine. I searched online and this one had great reviews (however, some people talked about switching out bolts, but I had no issues. This thing is PERFECT. Extremely sturdy and well made. The installation was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pull up bar this thing is rock solid
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pull up bar this thing is rock solid. I'm 195 lbs and i don't feel it move. Got better lag bolts just to be safe as other reviewers recommended, I didn't even chances the ones it comes with (I took off a star because of that). If you cant handle a drill, some wrenches, and finding studds this is not the pull up bar for you (that or hire someone to install it because it is a great one)
customer_reviews.author: Nick Hughes

customer_reviews.title: The BEST pull-up/chin up bar out there!
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best pull-up bar I've ever used! The construction is extremely solid and durable - coated steel that is secured to the wall with heavy 4in bolts. This thing doesn't wiggle or move at all once it's installed. Offers multiple grips for pull-ups and chin ups: the extra wide, inside, and 'hammer' grip. All grips are heavily padded and are very comfortable to use. If you have the space on your wall this is the bar to buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan F.

customer_reviews.title: like it but could have been a bit more sturdy..
customer_reviews.text: So far it has withstood my 170 lbs weight...but everytime I use it I feel like its pulling down, instead of being very firm on the wall--which was the main purpose I even bought this bar. But atleast it has not broken down and did not rip my wall/beam off. So I am okay. very helpful to do a few exercise at home with this baby...needful for a lazy person like me.
customer_reviews.author: Shetal Tiwari

customer_reviews.title: Poor hardware, as others have said
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, the hardware is junk. One of the lag screws broke on mine and is now a permanent part of the stud. Had to paint over it. It's alright otherwise...could maybe be a little more comfortable on the hands though.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Quality product that challanges me.
customer_reviews.text: I had an easy installation as my garage is unfinished.I drilled deep pilot holes and lubricated the threads prior to screwing them into the studs.I had no issues with the included hardware. I'm not a big guy(170 pounds) so there were no issues with it holding my weight.I would expect it to.I confess I cant do pull ups very well so I bought body bands to assist me until I get stronger on my own. I feel this product is very well made and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: bruce

customer_reviews.title: Yes!  Best purchase for a home gym.
customer_reviews.text: Box showed up with no damage to it or the equipment. Mounting wasn’t difficult even to do solo. I was about 200 pounds when I started using it and I’ve had no issues with bending or pulling away from the wall with 2-3 days a week of use for almost a year now. I would suggest this over door mounted options I’ve used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: kwa1207

customer_reviews.title: Like other folks here I received a dip bar instead ...
customer_reviews.text: Like other folks here I received a dip bar instead of a pull up bar...funny thing is that the box looked like it was returned already!!! So someone had the same issue I am facing. Another trip to UPS to return....!
customer_reviews.author: anonimous

customer_reviews.title: The video was good but the instructions from the vendor were not helpful ...
customer_reviews.text: I used a YouTube video to guide me on the installation. The video was good but the instructions from the vendor were not helpful at all. In fact they were going to have you drill the mounting pilots holes too big and then the bar would have not been secure. My big problem is that the wall mounted brackets/ post are not long enough and as a result you are TOO CLOSE to the wall when doing pull ups. You need more distance from the pull up bar and the wall. I would not recommend this device, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: David Conlon

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Just be sure you find the two by four studs in the wall and this bar works perfect very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Will Hm

customer_reviews.title: Nice width and depth for a variety of pull-ups - ...
customer_reviews.text: Feels solid. Nice width and depth for a variety of pull-ups - wide/narrow/etc. Easy to install. In my wall the studs, weren't exactly 16 inches apart so I had to fudge half an inch so one is not exactly smack dab in the middle of the stud. But it still feels sturdy and secure. Use this with P90X. Looks nice too in our basement workout/entertainment area.
customer_reviews.author: Silomi

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Okay. I bought this knowing that my husband would have to install it for me which he gladly did! The videos provided by other customers were very helpful. We ended up mounting 2x6's on the wall first as others had suggested. It is very sturdy and I use it all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, solid, handles for multiple grip positions
customer_reviews.text: Solid, basic pull up bar. Padded handles enable multiple grip positions for different pull up types. Small overall dimensions don't intrude into the overall view of the room.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy - mounts were sized perfectly for studs.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this purchase. The chin-up bar is very sturdy, easy to put up (I regard myself as fairly proficient at such things however), and is much nicer to use than my previous door mounted chin-up bar. One thing I'll note is that for some exercises it is best to face the wall, and for others to face away. Its not a deal breaker or really even a problem - you just have to be aware that if it feels awkward try it facing a different direction.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can adjust and still get a good work out though
customer_reviews.text: Very solid build quality, no problems there. For my particular build, I found that to do palms out or in chin ups, there is no padding and/or the jutting bars are right where I want to put my hands, for my shoulder width. I can adjust and still get a good work out though. I suspect also the foam rubber padding will eventually wear out sort of soon, but we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Home Deep Peaux

customer_reviews.title: Nice but could be a little wider
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'5" with a pretty big wingspan and I wish this bar was a couple inches wider on both sides. It's sturdy enough and comes with some big old screws that should keep it mounted well.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Robb

customer_reviews.title: Great bars but a standard pullup can be a bit awkward depending on your shoulder width.
customer_reviews.text: The bars are extremely solid and the grips are well padded, but the spacing is slightly awkward in that you can either do a very narrow grip or a very wide grip but not a neutral width pull up because of the strut spacing.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Humber

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to go in our new home gym after buying and returning a flimsy door frame model. This went up on the wall in about 15 minutes and has worked great, without any concern for it coming out of the wall or bending. We had a small house warming party shortly after it was installed and several <slightly inebriated = not gentle> people of different builds tried it out, and it didn't budge.
customer_reviews.author: velvetjunglepdx

customer_reviews.title: Nice bar, I needed to off set
customer_reviews.text: I found the holes closer to 16.25" and given that my studs were also a little off, I bought a hard wood piece of wood ($10 at Lowes) and used that as a base. I put three 3" screws into the studs, then lined up the bar where the left side (looking at it) was also in studs, but the right side had the bolts into the board with no stud access. I weigh 180 pound and it is no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry, Las Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy But would like a few things different
customer_reviews.text: Pros Well built. I had no problem installing this on 16" off center studs matched perfectly. The bolts worked well for me Cons Wish that the bar was a little wider The inside grip one my arms kind of run into the support bars. Also wish I had better instructions on install. I guessed (guess was right but not perfect. I installed it a little to high I think)
customer_reviews.author: TheBlueGrassCat

customer_reviews.title: Great for Garage gym
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my garage gym and it works perfect! Had a little problem hanging it, but once I figured out what to do, it is sturdy in the wall. I have metal studs so I used the nut and bolt with a spring that opens when you stick it in the stud and all you need to do is tighten until it is stuck. Works like a charm. Using the pull-up bar daily with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: SHAG

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I attached this to the wall in about 15 minutes. Very easy to install. I was 220lbs and 6' tall and using the resistant band for help. I could hang from this all day long and it won't budge.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Extremely strong and durable. Only downside is the grips start to go after a while. They are a foam material. Planning on getting rubber bicycle grips to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. I wanted something that I could attach to the wall, rather than from a doorway. Although a little pricey for what it is, it's SOLID. And with most things in life, you get what you pay for. I'm embarrassed to admit this but I'm up to a grand total of 5 pull ups (from my normal 1.5) because this is so user-friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Torchio

customer_reviews.title: Solid pull up bar
customer_reviews.text: The pull up bar feels and looks solid. It is a much better alternative to the doorway mount bar. It took me 15 minutes to pull mount the bar. Not sure why there is so much stink about the wood bolts as nothing stripped in my hands. The manual is a bit useless, I used the video posted by the top reviewer. The wrench included in the kit is useless along with plastic drywall inserts.
customer_reviews.author: S S

customer_reviews.title: This is SO MUCH better. Once mounted
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely well made product. I've bought and abused several over the door bars. This is SO MUCH better. Once mounted, it is incredibly sturdy. I've taken off one star because of poor assembly instruction. Also, if would be nicer if the bar was slightly further away from the wall. Otherwise, fantastic product. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Neil D. Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Great pull up bar
customer_reviews.text: I read all of the reviews from other buyers and that helped a lot. I'm not very good at all with handy stuff so this was a project for me - I did go to home depot and bought stronger lag bolts - not sure if it was needed but I followed a few of the other reviews - I have used it for the last 3 days and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install, Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I actually installed this product in a wood beam instead of going on a wall. It allowed me to both put it higher up and avoid any possible issues with being too close to a wall. I'm not sure how well it would work if attached to a wall, but it extends out fairly far. Seems like it would work. I'd worry more that it wasn't high enough off the floor.
customer_reviews.author: A. S. Bertagnolli

customer_reviews.title: Solid Construction
customer_reviews.text: This product was a gift for my husband and I must say he is very impressed. Solid construction, very sleek design and a perfect addition to our workout room. Very high quality and great customer service. Highly recommend this pull up bar.
customer_reviews.author: Swood

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good price
customer_reviews.text: Needed a pull up bar for my hangar, but the studs were 24” apart. Improvised with 4x4s for bracing & 7” lag bolts. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Pete D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy product.. Easy to install, lines up perfectly with the studs and holds a lot of weight without as a much as a slight bend. Would recommend for those that have larger sized door frames or want a more stable pull up bar. I attach my TRX to it and it works great for suspension training. Would recommend for anyone that doesn't mind putting a few holes in the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Yotz

customer_reviews.title: World’s best
customer_reviews.text: You can do all of the many kinds of pull ups with this bar. The best pull up bar I’ve ever used. Don’t waste your money, buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Stronger than it looks
customer_reviews.text: I was a little dubious when I first decided to purchase the bar, but once installed and having worked out on it for the last month, I have to say the doubts are gone. It is stronger than it looks and is easily installed. The only negative I have found is the grips need to be thicker and made of a more substantial material other than the heavy foam. A small negative for the price!
customer_reviews.author: P. Mascorro

customer_reviews.title: Great pull-up bar for home gym
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Strong and sturdy. Versatile with many grip options. Good price
customer_reviews.author: AreBee1987

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service from company website
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy construction. Nice grips, could be improved, but nice. Amazon shipped this item missing 1 bolt, I contacted amazon they offered 5 bucks, but all I really wanted was the bolt. I contacted the company at their website and they fed ex'd me a replacement bolt. A++ customer service.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: The setup itself is great, but the hardware
customer_reviews.text: The setup itself is great, but the hardware, although it says it has been updated with better hardware, still sucks. We had to purchase different, better lag bolts because the ones that came with it broke right away during install.
customer_reviews.author: MeadowsKL

customer_reviews.title: Great pull-up bar
customer_reviews.text: Great pull-up bar, but I did have to buy a drill bit to install it. I didn't have the right size already. Sturdy, well made, and serves it's purpose perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: pretty cool if you want to save space
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool if you want to save space in the garage however its a pain installing. The screws are massive which im sure is required however you have to get it directly in center of the stud or you will have problems. You have to hang perfectly straight while doing pull-ups or you will hit the wall.
customer_reviews.author: sjuled

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Quick workout whenever I’m in the mood. Friends are jealous.
customer_reviews.author: ronda

customer_reviews.title: They sent me the ceiling mount!!
customer_reviews.text: Did anyone else buy this and end up with the ceiling mount?! I did. I had to wait to install when my husband got home, so now I'm stuck with the ceiling mount because I ditched the box. Super irritated. If I wanted the ceiling mount I would have purchased it. I'm sure the quality is fine but not happy with the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Chay

customer_reviews.title: The product works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: A little difficult to find the studs, but that is my personal problem. The product works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Butts

customer_reviews.title: Solid Pull up bar
customer_reviews.text: Was very simple to install and came with all the necassary parts. Find your studs and get fit!
customer_reviews.author: TJ Eggsparza

customer_reviews.title: No regrets
customer_reviews.text: Solid all around bar. The grips won’t last under heavy use but well built piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Richardson

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: The product works, but one of the support brackets came with poor paint and rust at multiple places on the support bracket. The manufacturer took care of the issue and sent me a complete new unit! That is GREAT customer service. New item looks great!
customer_reviews.author: bjwert

customer_reviews.title: I have no idea what all those complaints are for?
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked great right out of box; I put a piece of 2x4 under it before installing, marked and drilled the holes, and installed using all the hardware that came with it. Nothing broke or failed so far, maybe I was careful or didn't apply unnecessary force on the bolts trying to install them without the pilot holes. This works great and serves it's main purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Rahmi

product_meta.title: Ultimate Body Press Wall Mount Pull Up Bar with 4 Grip Positions and Upgraded Design for 2019
product_meta.description: Get the Wall Mount Pull Up Bar designed for you and your home. The mounted bar is ultra stable for intense reps, provides full range of motion so you can move distraction free, and is always ready for a quick set to blast your metabolism even when you are tight on time.
feature_bullets: NEW IMPROVEMENTS for 2019: Upgraded 42 inch wide single-piece pull up bar is now top mounted on the risers for enhanced durability. Four dedicated grip positions expand workout options with overhand narrow-grip pull ups and true wide-grip pull ups.

RIGID MOUNT: The top rated Wall Mount Pull Up Bar by Ultimate Body Press bolts is built ultra-strong for strenuous workouts. A rigid bar frees you to focus on form and repetition so you can get more out of your workout time

EASY INSTALLATION: The Wall Mount Pull Up Bar is precision engineered for easy home installation on 16 inch on-center wall studs. Complete hardware, mounting template, instructions and USA tech support are included.

IDEAL ANCHOR: Anchor optional Bodyweight Resistance Trainers to turn your pull up bar into a full bodyweight gym. Complete full sets of pull ups and other challenging exercises right from day one with assisted exercise variations. [sold separately]

DESIGNED IN THE USA: Ultimate Body Press is a North Carolina company committed to delivering better workouts every day. Includes Prime eligible shipping, USA customer service and 100% satisfaction guarantee
10 YEAR WARRANTY: The Wall Mount Pull Up Bar is backed by Ultimate Body Press against manufacturer's defects for 10 years
The Maximum weight the bar can hold is 300 lbs.

BETTER WORKOUTS: Industry leading 14 - 21 inches of wall clearance provides maximum range of motion. High density foam grips reduce strain for longer workouts. Padded grip positions at 10, 16, 24, and 36 inches lets you target the results you want.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
